task.title: Custom Footer
task.shortdesc: How to include a custom footer for a link to your support channel in you implementation of Better Web Help.

taskbody.context: This assumes you have already built a Better Webhelp website, and the root directory is bwh/.

step.cmd: When you first build a BWH site, a default footer is loaded (footer.html). However, it contains a link to the easyDITA support website, so you should customize this file before launching your website.
Open footer.html in a text editing program, and you will see the following:

step.note: The footer.html file will only contain what's necessary for the footer (i.e. it should begin with the <span> as shown above). There is no need for <html>, <head>, or <body> tags.

step.cmd: Feel free to change the text ("Need help? Contact our support.") and the href link ("http://support.easydita.com/home") to tailor it to your site.
Leave the <span> surrounding it though. This will assure proper formatting on the site.

taskbody.result: On each page load, footer.html will be automatically insterted into the page.
